channel.title: python on rushiagr
channel.description: Recent content in python on rushiagr

item.title: Python Engineer Beginner Mistakes
item.description: I am writing Python code since 5 years, and I have worked with around 5-6 entry-level Python programmers. There is a pattern I can see in their programming practices. My hope is by reading this article there will be lesser such mistakes. I have worked on OpenStack for over three years, which is written in Python and has a very high code quality, so I feel I am qualified enough to write this post.

item.title: A different approach to AWS CLI
item.description: For a user of Amazon Web Services, quickly viewing a dashboard of all resources is not straightforward. If using a web browser, the session won't persist for more than a day and one will have to re-authenticate every day. If using AWS CLI, then he/she might not remember the exact command (was it describe-key-pair or describe-keypair or describe-keypairs?) but even if they do, the output is a not-so-readable JSON. For viewing virtual machines, you might not want to see hundreds of lines of detail.

item.title: Quick JustDial scraper
item.description: So my friend asked me to scrape data from JustDial and give it to him in an excel sheet. I thought let's give it a try. He needed name of firm, address and phone number of any JustDial URL he wants to scrape. After effectively around 4 hours of work, the below script was created. Note that the script is dirty. You need to edit the jd_url to search any other URL.
